brief_description of the content in the: The source URL provides information about incorrect @Profile expressions in Spring. It states that Spring profiles must not be empty and '&' and '|' operators must not be mixed without parentheses in Spring profile expressions.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'incorrect-profile-expression' checks all classes in the project. If a class has the @Profile annotation, it retrieves the value of the annotation which is the profile expression. If the profile expression is empty, it asserts false and generates a message indicating that the profile expression in the class is empty. If the profile expression contains both '&' and '|' operators and does not start and end with parentheses, it asserts false and generates a message indicating that the profile expression in the class mixes '&' and '|' operators without parentheses.
3rd-party most relevant URLs and summary:
https://www.baeldung.com/spring-profiles: This page from Baeldung provides a comprehensive guide to using @Profile in Spring. It explains how to define and activate profiles, and how to use profile expressions.
https://docs.spring.io/spring-framework/docs/current/reference/html/core.html#beans-definition-profiles: This is the official Spring documentation for bean definition profiles. It explains how to use the @Profile annotation and how to define profile expressions.
